detaileddescription.para: These HOST_API_TYPES will not change in the future.

simplesect.para: the release number of the currently running PortAudio build, eg 1900.
a textual description of the current PortAudio build, eg "PortAudio V19-devel 13 October 2002".

detaileddescription.para: Library initialization function - call this before using PortAudio. This function initializes internal data structures and prepares underlying host APIs for use. With the exception of getVersion(), getVersionText(), and getErrorText(), this function MUST be called before using any other PortAudio API functions.

Library termination function - call this when finished using PortAudio. This function deallocates all resources allocated by PortAudio since it was initialized by a call to initialize(). In cases where Pa_Initialise() has been called multiple times, each call must be matched with a corresponding call to terminate(). The final matching call to terminate() will automatically close any PortAudio streams that are still open.

simplesect.para: the number of available devices. The number of available devices may be zero.

parameterdescription.para: A valid device index in the range 0 to (getDeviceCount()-1)
if the device parameter is out of range.

simplesect.para: the number of available host APIs.

parameterdescription.para: A unique host API identifier, for example HOST_API_TYPE_COREAUDIO.
A valid host API index ranging from 0 to (getHostApiCount()-1)
A valid per-host device index in the range 0 to (getHostApiInfo(hostApi).deviceCount-1)

simplesect.para: 0 if supported or a negative error

memberdef.argsstring: (StreamParameters inputStreamParameters, StreamParameters outputStreamParameters, int sampleRate, int framesPerBuffer, int flags)
memberdef.name: openStream

memberdef.argsstring: (BlockingStream blockingStream, StreamParameters inputStreamParameters, StreamParameters outputStreamParameters, int sampleRate, int framesPerBuffer, int flags)
memberdef.name: openStream

detaileddescription.para: Java methods that call PortAudio via JNI. This is a portable audio I/O library that can be used as an alternative to JavaSound.
Please see the PortAudio documentation for a full explanation.

This Java binding does not support audio callbacks because an audio callback should never block. Calling into a Java virtual machine might block for garbage collection or synchronization. So only the blocking read/write mode is supported.
